Class Screen

java.lang.Object
Screen
public class Screen extends Object
Class Screen represents a screen in a multiplex cinema.
Version:
2022.12.08
Author:
Hari Rathod k22002783

  • Constructor Details

    • Screen

      public Screen(int id, int numberOfColumns, int numberOfRows)
      Constructor for objects of class Screen. Each row has a fixed length of 20 seats. If the number of seats for a screen is 5, then the screen will contain 1 row, with 20 seats. If the number of seats provided is 21, the screen will contain 2 rows, each with 20 seats (40 seats total).
      Parameters:
      numberOfSeats - The minimum number of seats the screen should have.

  • Method Details

    • emptyScreen

      public void emptyScreen()
      Empty the screen - make every seat available.

    • getNumberOfSeats

      public int getNumberOfSeats()
      Get the total number of seats.
      Returns:
      The total number of seats.

    • book

      public boolean book(int seatNumber, int rowNumber)
      Take the seat's seat and row number, and mark that seat as booked. Return false if the seat was already booked. Return true if the seat was not already booked, to show the booking has been confirmed.
      Returns:
      True if the booking was successful, false if it was not (if the seat was already booked).

    • newMovie

      public void newMovie(String newMovieTitle, int ticketCost)
      Change the screen to show a new movie, with a new ticket cost.
      Parameters:
      newMovieTitle - The new title of the movie.
      ticketCost - The cost of a ticket to see this movie.

    • getDetails

      public String getDetails()
      Get the details of the screen, including id, current movie, and ticket cost.
      Returns:
      The details of the screen.

    • getRandomTicket

      public Ticket getRandomTicket()
      Get a random ticket.
      Returns:
      A ticket object if there is at least one available seat, otherwise return null.

    • getMovieTitle

      public String getMovieTitle()
      Get the title of the movie showing in a screen.
      Returns:
      The title of the movie being shown.
